unit_learning_outcomes.description: Work effectively, independently and cooperatively with peers, academics and/or clinicians  in a collaborative research environment to successfully complete a research project. (Professional)
Apply both independent and collaborative strategies to advance your research knowledge and skills relevant to your research project. (Scientist and Scholar)
Effectively reflect and discuss research processes and communicate research findings in a professional manner. (Professional)
Implement appropriate research methodology, skills and data analysis strategies to answer a research question relevant to physiotherapy practice and/or healthcare. (Scientist and Scholar)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Undertaking all aspects of the research project.
Research project and assessment support and resources.

assessments.description: You will present your completed research project in the form of a manuscript as if for submission to a journal.
You will provide evidence of effective participation in research project processes.
Provide evidence of advanced skill development and reflect on your performance in an online forum with peers and academic staff.
You will deliver an oral presentation of your research findings.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit will extend your research skills to successfully undertake and complete a research project, demonstrating the capacity to generate new knowledge and apply existing knowledge to answer a question relevant to physiotherapy. Working closely with a research supervisor you will integrate your professional, clinical and research skills to collect, evaluate and analyse data, and then interpret and disseminate the results.
data.title: Research Project and Seminar

description: This unit will extend your research skills to successfully undertake and complete a research project, demonstrating the capacity to generate new knowledge and apply existing knowledge to answer a question relevant to physiotherapy. Working closely with a research supervisor you will integrate your professional, clinical and research skills to collect, evaluate and analyse data, and then interpret and disseminate the results.
title: Research Project and Seminar
